value:
Welcome

Welcome to the University of Wisconsin-Milwaukee SAP University Competence Center. The goal of the UWM UCC is to provide the best service possible to those universities that are our customers. While some of the website features are available to the public, most are designed to provide a self service website for our customers. These customer specific sections require a login (your email address) and a password.
description: Content on the right side of the contact page

value: The UCC sessions are used to define when systems are available and when you can request products. A session classified as Active is the currently active session whereas when a session classified as Requests it means customers may request products but the systems are not yet available. A Next status means that we are not taking requests yet but will be soon. Use the information on this page to plan. We don't extend products across sessions so make sure you choose the session that matches your requirements.

Client requests open 1 month before the term begins.

value:
What is a SAP UCC

The SAP University Competence Center (UCC) at the Lubar School of Business is one of only six UCCs throughout the world. The center provides hosting services and technical support to universities that participate in SAPâ€™s University Alliance.

value: This site is for the faculty of the SAP University Alliances only.  Please do not register if you are not a faculty member.
description: Message shown in the toolbar on the register page.

value:
This is a computer generated notification that the UWM UCC staff has created a help ticket for  you. This ticket may be regarding your SAP client request/assignment, created from an email you sent to the UCC or other matters. Without your attention, the UCC is not able to proceed with your requests or inquiry.If you do not respond within 5 business days, the UWM UCC may presume the email, client request or other information is no longer relevant. We may cancel a requested client if follow-up is not received.

To review and respond to the help ticket, logon to <a href='http://ucc.uwm.edu'>http://ucc.uwm.edu</a>.  Go to the Support menu and select View Help Tickets. Open your help ticket by selecting the line of the referenced ticket number.  Select the Respond icon to respond and/or attach documents. Select Save. The system will update the ticket status and notify the UCC staff.
description: Email body for UCC created help tickets

value: The UCC has created Help Ticket [[No]] for [[faculty name]]
description: Subject line for UCC created help tickets

value: Do not reply to this email. If you wish to respond, please contact the UCC directly. The UCCSS website Help Ticket system is the preferred communication channel.
description: Instructions in help ticket emails

value: This is a computer generated notification that your help ticket number <#> has been submitted and will be reviewed by the UWM UCC staff. You will receive an email when we have information to share, need further information from you, or when we resolve your issue. To monitor the status or update your help ticket, logon to http://ucc.uwm.edu.  Go to the Support menu and select View Help Tickets. Open your help ticket by selecting the line of the referenced ticket number.  Select the Respond icon to respond and/or attach documents. Select Save. The system will update the ticket status and notify the UCC staff.
description: Email body when user creates Help Ticket

value:
This is a computer generated notification that the UWM UCC staff has updated the status of help ticket <No> to Customer Action. The UCC is either requesting additional information from you or has provided a solution and is awaiting confirmation that the issue is resolved. Without your attention, the UCC staff may not not be able to provide further support on this ticket. If you do not respond within 5 business days, the UWM UCC may presume the issue has been resolved or is no longer relevant and may close the ticket.

To review and respond to the help ticket, logon to http://ucc.uwm.edu. Go to the Support menu and select View Help Tickets. Open your help ticket by selecting the line of the referenced ticket number. Select the Respond icon to respond and/or attach documents. Select Save. The system will update the ticket status and notify the UCC staff.
description: Email body when help ticket is updated by UCC

value: The UCC has updated your Help Ticket [[No]]. Ticket status is Customer Action.
description: Subject line when UCC updates a help ticket
Subject when user creates Help Ticket

value: This is a computer generated notification that the UWM UCC staff has updated your help ticket [[No]].  To monitor the status or update your help ticket logon to <a href='http://ucc.uwm.edu'>http://ucc.uwm.edu</a>.  Go to the Support menu and select View Help Tickets. Open your help ticket by selecting the line of the referenced ticket number.  Select the Respond icon to respond and/or attach documents. Select Save. The system will update the ticket status and notify the UCC staff.   The UCC staff will update the ticket and generate another system email when we have additional information to provide, need further information from you, or have resolved your issue.
The UCC has updated your Help Ticket <No>. Ticket status is Under Review.
The UCC has closed your Help ticket [[No]]

This is a computer generated notification that the UWM UCC staff has closed your ticket [[No]].To review our closing comments, logon to http://ucc.uwm.edu.  Go to the Support Menu and select View Help Tickets. Open your help ticket by selecting the line of the referenced help ticket number.  (Toggle hide/unhide closed tickets with the check box.)
